newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-ASPRILLA PULLS OUT OF COLOMBIA WORLD CUP GAME.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ASPRILLA PULLS OUT OF COLOMBIA WORLD CUP GAME.

text.p: Colombian forward Faustino Asprilla has pulled out of his country's World Cup qualifier in Venezuela next week after straining a hamstring in Newcastle's 2-0 UEFA Cup victory over Metz on Tuesday night.
Asprilla, who scored both Newcastle goals, blamed himself and the rain-soaked St James Park pitch for the injury.

"I probably need to do more exercises in the warm-up to stop this problem occurring again," he said. "It's the first time I've had a problem like this with the right leg and it's probably because of the heavier pitches."
Newcastle manager Kevin Keegan said Asprilla could be sidelined for six weeks but club physio Derek Wright said he might be back before the end of the year.
Colombia are top of the South American World Cup qualifying group with four wins and two draws from their six games. Venezuela are bottom and have yet to win.
